Generation VII.Sun: They form groups of roughly 20 individuals. Their mutual bond is remarkable—they will never let down a comrade.
Generation VII.Moon: They battle with hard berries for weapons. Their techniques are passed from the boss to the group, generation upon generation.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: They use their saliva to stick leaves to their shoulders. You can tell what troop they belong to from the position of the leaves.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Berries are its weapons as well as the staple of its diet. The one that can throw a berry the farthest is the boss of the troop.

Generation VIII.Sword: Displaying amazing teamwork, they follow the orders of their boss as they all help out in the search for their favorite berries.
Generation VIII.Shield: Passimian live in groups of about 20, with each member performing an assigned role. Through cooperation, the group survives.

Generation IX.Scarlet: This Pokémon battles by throwing hard berries. It won’t obey a Trainer who throws Poké Balls without skill.
Generation IX.Violet: The boss chooses 10 members of the group to go out hunting. The hunting party will evenly split the food they find with the rest of the group.

Generation VIII.Sword: Glimwood Tangle Rolling Fields , North Lake Miloch , Dusty Bowl ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Sword Expansion Pass: Forest of Focus Max Lair ( Dynamax Adventure )

Generation IX.Scarlet: Union Circle Tera Raid Battle Search ( 3★ , 5★ )
Generation IX.Violet: East Province: Tagtree Thicket North Province: Area Two Tera Raid Battles ( 3★ , 5★ )
